page.title: 01General Description
page.content: The area being described is to the { {South and East of Beckwithshaw,}which itself is {South of Harrogate.}A very {rural area}with scattered farms and cottages all of Yorkshire stone, totalling around 45 dwellings in all, some 20 of these being working farms. {Crimple Beck}runs through the centre,travelling{eastwards}through {Pannal,Follifoot and Spofforth. Bordering on what was the old Forest of Knaresborough, the area is undulating hills,{rising to some {230feet above sea level}at its highest point. The west of our area being moorland with rain,mist,wind and sunshime, ever changing, because of its open aspect. At its{lower level it {drops down 100feet}to the beck. A very green area, with many trees and beautiful long distance views.
